title: Petrified Forest National Park: Visitor Centers
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Places To Go     Visitor Centers              Visitor Centers       See Operating Hours & Seasons for current visitor center hours.         Painted Desert Visitor Center Info Desk NPS  Painted Desert Visitor Center Found in the historic Painted Desert Community Complex  Open all year and located at exit #311 off of I-40 Services include:  visitor information, orientation, and backcountry permits Timeless Impressions, a free 20 minute orientation film, shown continuously bookstore hands-on exhibits restaurant (open 8am-3pm MST) short loop walking trail with signage exploring park points of interest gift shop gas station postal drop box picnic pavilion  public restrooms          Family in dining room of the Painted Desert Inn NPS/Susan McElhinney, Artist-in-Residence  Painted Desert Inn National Historic Landmark  Located at Kachina Point, 2 miles (3.2 km) from the north entrance at exit #311 off of I-40. The inn once served as a respite for travelers along historic Route 66. Read more on the inn's history pages. Services include:   museum and gallery space visitor information, orientation, and backcountry permits  sweeping desert vistas  Access to Painted Desert Rim Trail and Petrified Forest National Wilderness Area public restrooms          Kids can dig like paleontologists in Rainbow Forest Museum's Blue Mesa Room NPS  Rainbow Forest Museum  One of many historic buildings in Rainbow Forest Complex Located near the southern entrance to the park, off US-180 Services include:   visitor information, orientation, and backcountry permits Timeless Impressions, a free 20 minute orientation film, shown continuously paleontological exhibits complete with skeleton displays of prehistoric animals bookstore Access to Giant Logs, Long Logs, and Agate House Trails gift shop with limited snacks picnic pavilion  public restrooms
